author: Press Association
title: Three men die after 4√ó4 recovered from river - Press and Journal
text:
Three men die after 4√ó4 recovered from river By Press Association December 28 2023, 6.03pm Share Three men die after 4√ó4 recovered from river Share via Facebook Twitter Whatsapp Messenger Linkedin Email Post link https://www.pressandjournal.co.uk/news/uk/6310501/three-men-die-after-4x4-recovered-from-river/ Copy Link (Dave Thompson/PA)
Three men have died after a 4√ó4 vehicle was recovered from a river on the North York Moors, police said.
Emergency services including police, ambulance and air support attended a location on the River Esk near Glaisdale shortly before midday on Thursday.
A 4√ó4 was recovered from the river by the fire service just after 3pm and three men found inside have died, North Yorkshire Police said.
Another man who attempted to help those in the vehicle was pulled to safety from the river and has been receiving medical treatment.
Emergency services have been dealing with a serious incident on Thursday (28 December) involving a 4√ó4 vehicle in the River Esk near Glaisdale on the North York Moors üö®
Three men sadly died at the scene.
More information is available here ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/KgxPhHATO4 pic.twitter.com/AvDT3TiqCk
‚Äî North Yorkshire Police (@NYorksPolice) December 28, 2023
A police spokesperson advised people to travel with care after the ‚Äútragic incident‚Äù.
It comes after Storm Gerrit caused flooding and travel chaos across the country throughout Wednesday and Thursday.
The spokesperson said: ‚ÄúLocalised conditions across our area are making driving hazardous.
‚ÄúRoads are particularly badly affected around the River Esk, to the north of the county, as we have seen with the tragic incident near Glaisdale.
‚ÄúThere was another incident at nearby Houlsyke at 12.49pm when a car got stuck in flood water and another at Kirby Wiske in Hambleton at 2.35pm.
‚ÄúThankfully, the occupants of both vehicles were brought to safety.
‚ÄúThe key advice is to consider whether your journey is necessary.
‚ÄúPlease avoid driving through any kind of standing or moving flood water if you possibly can.‚Äù
Witnesses to the incident are urged to call North Yorkshire Police on 101, option 4, quoting reference NYP-28122023-0146.

author: RenewAmerica
title: HAPPY EASTER: A message to all who love our country and want to help save it!
text:
RENEWAMERICA ‚Äî Keeping in mind that "God anointed Jesus of Nazareth with the Holy Ghost and with power: who went about doing good, and healing all that were oppressed of the devil" (
see Acts 10:38), let us all resolve to do our best to do as Jesus did ‚Äî with the help of God's Spirit ‚Äî to please God in all aspects of our lives with all our "heart, soul, and mind," as Jesus commands us to do in Matthew 22:37.
Such sincere effort to improve our influence in our divinely-inspired, divinely-created nation is consistent with God‚Äôs emphatic warning to all of us in
2 Chronicles 7:14 that
If my people, which are called by my name, shall humble themselves, and pray, and seek my face, and turn from their wicked ways; then will I hear from heaven, and will forgive their sin, and will heal their land.
These vital scriptural words are more relevant today than ever, as our culture continues to move steadily away from God‚Äôs laws and from our nation‚Äôs founding principles as a direct consequence of godless Marxists‚Äô and Leftists‚Äô increasingly successful ‚Äú
Long march through our nation‚Äôs institutions‚Äù over the past hundred-plus years.
To the extent any of us can do so, we each need to awake and arise and stand forth in courage and righteous indignation and take back our country upon the principles of the Constitution, the Declaration of Independence, and the Bible‚Äîwith God‚Äôs help and the power of His Spirit, as well as with all the faith we can muster as we seek to please God in all we do, and to obey His Spirit in everything we undertake in our daily lives‚Äîjust as Jesus did, as cited above in
 Acts 10:38.

author: Eduardo Oliveira
title: Voz de Venom chegou ao Waze para lhe dar todas as indica√ß√µes de viagem
text:
Conduzir pode ser uma tarefa aborrecida. Caso use a Waze, h√° uma forma de tornar tudo mais divertido. Como? Trocando a voz que vai dando indica√ß√µes. E no elenco de vozes, h√° uma novidade para os f√£s de super-her√≥is.
Este ano, a empresa incluiu na aplica√ß√£o a voz da drag queen e cantora brasileira Pabllo Vittar. Agora, tem uma nova voz de pode ouvir enquanto navega pela cidade.
A 14 de outubro, a aplica√ß√£o detida pela Google lan√ßou uma nova atualiza√ß√£o onde os protagonistas s√£o Eddie Brock e Venom, cuja voz √© dada pelo ator Tom Hardy. Para poder utilizar esta atualiza√ß√£o, basta carregar no pop-up que surge no menu do lado esquerdo.
Tal como acontece no filme, as personagens v√£o estar constantemente a discutir de forma hilariante, enquanto lhe d√£o informa√ß√µes sobre o tr√¢nsito e a rota aconselhada para chegar mais rapidamente ao destino.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O1lXLmv02_c
Esta novidade surge para promover o lan√ßamento de ‚ÄúVenom: A √öltima Dan√ßa‚Äù, filme que chega aos cinemas portugueses a 24 de outubro. ‚ÄúTom Hardy regressa como Venom, um dos maiores e mais complexos personagens da Marvel, para o √∫ltimo filme da trilogia. Eddie e Venom est√£o em fuga. Perseguidos pelos seus dois mundos e com o cerco a apertar, a dupla √© for√ßada a tomar uma decis√£o devastadora‚Äù, l√™-se na sinopse. Desta vez, o vil√£o vai ser Knull, que tamb√©m √© um dos principais inimigos de Venom nas bandas-desenhadas da Marvel.
Carregue na galeria e conhe√ßa algumas das s√©ries e temporadas que estreiam em outubro nas plataformas de streaming e canais de televis√£o.

author: Tom Kuser
title: Yellow haze: The impact of wildfire smoke in CT and NY
text: Yellow haze: The impact of wildfire smoke in CT and NY Smoke from the massive wildfires in Canada was a serious climate and health concern for our region this year. The sky was filled with a noxious yellow haze that traveled across the northeast, to the Midwest, and even to Europe. The gritty air drove many people to wear masks once again to protect their health. Right now the air has cleared, but concerns over the impact on public health and the environment remain. Morning Edition Host Tom Kuser speaks with the American Lung Association and an environmental scientist about the effects of the smoke and if this may be the beginning of a climate shift we‚Äôll have to manage in the future. GUESTS: Trevor Summerfield, Director of Advocacy for the [American Lung Association](https://www.lung.org/)in NY Dr. David Hill, Pulmonologist and board member of the [American Lung Association](https://www.lung.org/) in CT Dr. Kristina Wagstrom, Eversource Energy Associate Professor of [Environmental Engineering Education at UConn](https://environ.engr.uconn.edu/) MORNING EDITION FEATURE: Lung Help Line: 1-800-LUNGUSA Check the air quality in your area: [https://www.airnow.gov/](https://www.airnow.gov/)

author: Saibhaveesh Beemireddy
title: Oregon State University uses 3D scanning to map historical structures at Silver Falls State Park
text:
SILVER FALLS STATE PARK, Ore. ‚Äî Oregon State University researchers are helping preserve the legacy of Silver Falls State Park by using three-dimensional scanning to produce digital replicas of the park‚Äôs historical structures.
The work is especially timely given the increasing frequency of wildfires in Oregon and throughout the West, with fires destroying similar historical structures at Jawbone Flats in the Opal Creek Wilderness and at Breitenbush Hot Springs in Oregon in 2020.
‚ÄúHaving a digital record of these buildings is essential, as that may be the only record we have,‚Äù said Todd Kesterson, senior instructor in OSU‚Äôs New Media Communications program and project director for the 3D scanning work. ‚ÄúIf something is damaged or lost, that record can be used for repair or restoration.‚Äù
He pointed to the example of Notre Dame in Paris, which suffered significant loss in a fire in 2019. An art historian had conducted 3D scanning of the building in 2015, providing a perfect blueprint for the iconic cathedral to be rebuilt to an accuracy of within 5 millimeters.
For the Silver Falls project, Kesterson teamed up with Michael Olsen and Ezra Che in OSU‚Äôs College of Engineering. The project was paid for with a $14,163 grant from the Oregon Heritage State Historic Preservation Office.
The work involves two types of technology: photogrammetry and laser scanning. Photogrammetry uses a camera to take successive images of a structure, and then uses structure-from-motion software to stitch those photos together to build a three-dimensional digital replica. Laser scanning uses lidar (light detection and ranging) technology to record millions of points per second, measuring and mapping the exact shape and location of a structure at a high resolution.
The team selected three of the most well-known structures at the park: the South Falls Lodge, the South Falls Nature Store and the Stone Kitchen Shelter. They were built in the 1930s by the Civilian Conservation Corps as part of the New Deal, and most park visitors walk past them en route to the falls.
Olsen, Che and a group of graduate students set up laser scanners on tripods at various sites around and inside each building, capturing three-dimensional panoramas from different angles as the scanner rotated 360 degrees. They also sent a large drone 300 feet into the sky to take aerial photos.
Olsen said the bulk of his work focuses on monitoring infrastructure and natural environments for stability and erosion, but he has also done a lot of historical preservation work, even scanning the Renaissance-era Palazzo Medici in Italy to map the building‚Äôs deterioration.
The researchers spent a day last month at Silver Falls gathering 3D scans. They will spend the next year processing the data and stitching the scans together to build digital models. Once complete, the photogrammetry models will be uploaded to a public database.
The precise digital models built from the laser scanning data will be given to the Oregon Parks and Recreation Department for them to keep and use for future restoration or rebuilding, whether due to a fire or other natural disaster, or the typical wear-and-tear that historical buildings experience.
Park ranger Matt Palmquist was among those evacuated from Silver Falls during the 2020 Beachie Creek Fire, and said park management was told there was only enough time and manpower to protect one structure. They chose the South Falls Lodge, putting sprinklers on the roof and moving all the historically significant objects outside the park. But it was ‚Äúheart-wrenching‚Äù to think of the building going up in smoke, he said.
‚ÄúWe get over a million visitors here at Silver Falls, and probably 90 to 95% of them walk right through this district and right past these buildings,‚Äù Palmquist said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a really excellent spot to showcase the history here and the work of the Civilian Conservation Corps here at Silver Falls.‚Äù
Kesterson hopes that the Silver Falls work will highlight the importance of increasing 3D scanning of historical structures in Oregon and throughout the U.S., even though structures like the South Falls Lodge don‚Äôt receive national or international attention.
‚ÄúI do hope this kind of project leads to greater awareness and has people really understand that this is an important part of our history, and we need to protect it on a digital level, as well,‚Äù he said.
[
College of Liberal Arts
](/boilerplate/college-liberal-arts)
About the OSU College of Liberal Arts: The College of Liberal Arts encompasses seven distinct schools, as well as several interdisciplinary initiatives, that focus on humanities, social sciences, and fine and performing arts. Curriculum developed by the college‚Äôs nationally and internationally-renowned faculty prepares students to approach the complex problems of the world ethically and thoughtfully, contributing to a student's academic foundation and helping to build real-world skills for a 21st century career and a purposeful life.
Molly Rosbach, [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#ec8183808095c29e839f8e8d8f84ac839e898b83829f988d9889c2898899)
Todd Kesterson, [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#442f2137302136372b2a042b3621232b2a37302530216a212031); Michael Olsen, [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#82efebe1eae3e7eeacedeef1e7ecc2edf0e7e5edecf1f6e3f6e7ace7e6f7); Ezra Che, [[email protected]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#d6b3a4acbea3b9f8b5beb396b9a4b3b1b9b8a5a2b7a2b3f8b3b2a3)

author: Laura Pancini
title: Fora do BBB, Yasmin Brunet fatura R$ 30 milh√µes com cosm√©ticos veganos
text:
A modelo Yasmin Brunet √© uma das participantes do " Camarote ", grupo de celebridades do BBB 24 . A carioca de 35 anos agora √© sister e disputar√° a chance por um pr√™mio de, no m√≠nimo, R$ 1,5 milh√µes de reais. Fora da casa mais vigiada do Brasil, a filha de Luiza Brunet √© conhecida pelos seus trabalhos como modelo, atriz e influenciadora, al√©m da sua marca de produtos de beleza, Yasmin Beauty .
A linha come√ßou em 2022 com um √≥leo para cabelos cruelty-free ‚Äì cujos testes n√£o s√£o feitos em animais ‚Äì, que rendeu R$ 1 milh√£o em vendas nas primeiras 24 horas de lan√ßamento. Somente naquele ano, a marca faturou R$ 30 milh√µes .
J√° em 2023, a expectativa √© de aumentar este valor em at√© 60%, deixando o faturamento na faixa dos R$ 50 milh√µes. E desta vez, com mais produtos dispon√≠veis: ao longo do ano, a Yasmin Beauty lan√ßou sua linha completa de produtos para corpo e cabelo, que incluem body splash , spray leave-in , shampoo, condicionador e √≥leo capilar.
Empreendedora Em entrevista √† EXAME alguns meses antes do confinamento, Brunet contou sobre seus desafios desenvolvendo os produtos de sua primeira marca. "Eu estou envolvida em tudo. Embalagem, nome, ingredientes, cheiros... e sou muito chata com isso, ent√£o tem produtos que, por exemplo, eram para ter sa√≠do faz tempo, mas eles n√£o estavam absolutamente perfeitos", conta.
"Para mim, o mais dif√≠cil √© que sou uma pessoa muito criativa, ent√£o tenho um milh√£o de ideias e quero agarr√°-las e fazer tudo ao mesmo tempo. √â algo que eu tenho que aprender, a aquietar minha mente. Mas por sorte, tenho uma equipe maravilhosa que me ajuda com tudo", disse a modelo.
O foco para 2024 √© trabalhar mais no branding e conhecimento da marca, explorando al√©m da imagem de Yasmin. A equipe da Yasmin Beauty est√° assinando com influenciadores de m√©dio a grande porte, para investir no marketing visual.
No futuro, Brunet espera que a marca toque em todas as √°reas da beleza, incluindo maquiagem. "Os produtos s√£o feitos para todo tipo de pessoa, cabelo e pele. Hoje em dia, se cuidar √© um ato de amor pr√≥prio e quero que as pessoas tirem tempo para cuidar delas mesmas", disse.
Quem √© Yasmin Brunet? A modelo Yasmin Brunet tem 35 anos e √© do Rio de Janeiro. Filha da tamb√©m modelo Luiza Brunet, come√ßou a carreira aos 13 anos, com o apoio da m√£e, a tamb√©m modelo Luiza Brunet. Seu primeiro desfile foi na S√£o Paulo Fashion Week.
Aos 17, mudou-se para Nova Iorque, nos Estados Unidos, onde morou por nove anos para se dedicar √†s passarelas. Como modelo fotogr√°fica, representou diversas marcas internacionais e, durante a carreira, estampou capas de revistas e participou de semanas de moda no Brasil e no exterior. Tamb√©m fez um trabalho como atriz, em 2015, na novela ‚ÄòVerdades Secretas‚Äô.
